reviewText: I never thought this series would be released but thanks to Universal's cross-marketing of "The Wolfman" movie we now have it!  Reminds me of when Sony released "Tabitha" when the horrible "Bewitched" movie was released.It's such a shame Universal didn't include the original opening for the first 14 episodes.  I am sure it was completely accidental.  So many studios really don't know their material as well as the fans do.  That's why Studios really should contact a fan website every now and then and get some input or let them preview the check-discs...but they are probably afraid of confidential information being leaked.  So mistakes like this happen.  The original theme and opening are so great too....So much better than the "Love and Curses" theme and opening.  I guess I'll have to dig my Sci-Fi channel recorded VHS' out of storage and transfer the opening.Thanks anyway Universal for releasing this great show!  I really do appreciate it!  Next time though, do a little more research, please.BTW, UNIVERSAL, Can we please have the final seasons of "Amazing Stories" (Season 2), "SeaQuest 2032," and Sliders (Season 5).  It seems such a shame to release every season except the last!  You've come so close!
summary: Glad it made it out, but can't help being a little disappointed...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had never heard of this series til I saw it at the store in the DVD aisles. Being a werewolf fan, I snagged it up to add to my collection. If only the those grounds of rebuilding my collection after a divorce where I'm not sure if I still have every book or dvd related and what has to be replaced...Definently an 80's hanger on with the style of episodes and script writing. And you can see that styling of horror-comedy that's found in Kolchak and is very prevalent through Buffy the Vampire Slayer series. I'd dub it a proto-type to Buffy.It's a shame that the British Financial backing is what causes the move for the series from England to L.A. The London based episodes are the best and with the L.A. episodes it's, you can see it going down hill despite some good moments.Still a good series if you can get past the opening credits deal that's hokey. Just evidence of where you see the 80's feel attached if not the L.A. episodes. Mystical Pizza reminded me of Facts of Life and Cheers for handling of the episode overall and filming.

reviewText: It's almost surreal writing this review, because I had given up hope of ever seeing She-Wolf on DVD, especially after the crappy way the show was treated by producers and syndicators. This bizarre, well-written and acted show is intelligent, funny and even scary at times... with characters you give a damn about. Buy it now.
summary: Finally, the hilarious horror comedy hits DVD

reviewText: I bought She-Wolf of London:The Complete Series..and found it charming and different..compared to the other shows of its type such as "Forever Knight"..Friday 13th the TV series...and a bit of "Buffy"....the action does get a little bloody at times but not especially gory..It has more stories that remind me of "Kolchak the Night Stalker" than anything else..It is shot in England...and various places in The British Isles...The show gets atmospheric at times. The actors work very well together...the chemistry between Kate Hodge and Neil Dikson develops rather quickly..on the first disc.Only one minor tiny flaw with this set...i think the opening music sucks.."70s style" so i just mute the opening music . I still gave the show 5 stars cause i really liked it...Oh yes, i bought this complete set from Amazon.com...

reviewText: Whatever you do, don't miss the very fun and engaging TV series "SHE-WOLF OF LONDON" (Episodes 1-14) and "LOVE & CURSES" (Episodes 15-20)!  This unforgettable horror/drama/comedy/romance series aired as part of the short-lived (and poorly distributed) Hollywood Premiere Network (1990-91) of syndicated shows.  The Hollywood Premiere Network consisted of only three shows: "SHE-WOLF OF LONDON", "SHADES OF L.A." and "THEY CAME FROM OUTER SPACE".  "SHE-WOLF OF LONDON" was finally seen across the entire country when it aired on The SCI-FI Channel in the mid-90's as part of their "Sci-Fi Fridays" prime-time line-up.  The beautiful Kate Hodge ("Rapid Fire", "The Hidden II", "Leatherface: Texas Chainsaw Massacre III") stars as Randi Wallace, a young American graduate student living in England who is cursed to become a werewolf every full moon.  Neil Dickson ("Biggles: Adventures in Time", the evil Rickman on Season 3 of "SLIDERS") stars as Ian Matheson, professor of mythology, and  Randi's would-be love-interest.  Together, the duo search for a cure for Randi's curse and also investigate other supernatural occurences.  With Episode #15, the series title and format changed to "LOVE & CURSES" and production moved to Los Angeles.  Ian quits academia and gets a job as the host of "How Strange", a Los Angeles-area TV show which focused on the supernatural, and Randi becomes his producer.  The following is a list of episode titles with original airdates:"SHE-WOLF OF LONDON":1. "She-Wolf of London" (pilot) (10/09/902. "The Bog Man of Letchmoor Heath" (10/16/90)3. "Moonlight Becomes You" (10/23/90)4. "The Juggler" (10/30/90)5. "Nice Girls Don't" (11/06/90)6. "Little Bookshop of Horrors" (11/13/90)7. "Can't Keep a Dead Man Down, part one" (11/20/90)8. "Can't Keep a Dead Man Down, part two" (11/27/90)9. "The Wild Hunt" (12/04/90)10. "What's Got Into Them?" (12/12/90)11. "Big Top She-Wolf" (01/12/91)12. "She-Devil" (01/19/91)13. "Voodoo Child" (01/26/91)14. "Beyond the Beyond" (02/09/91) (An unforgettable spoof of STAR TREK and science fiction conventions!)Series Title Changes to "LOVE & CURSES"15. "Curiousity Killed the Kravitz" (03/06/91)16. "Habeas Corpses" (03/13/91)17. "Bride of the Wolfman" (03/20/91)18. "Heart Attack" (03/27/91)19. "Mystical Pizza" (04/03/91)20. "Eclipse" (04/10/91)Don't hesitate to purchase "SHE-WOLF OF LONDON" on DVD!!!  It is well worth your time, I assure you!

reviewText: This is a pretty good show, if you could get past it not truly being a horror show. It sometimes tries to be funny, so it is sort of like Buffy Vampire Slayer, though nowhere as good. Each episode is independent with each a horror or supernatural storyline, and doesn't carry over. Different monsters or evil-doer every episode. It's not like a serial, where there's a cliffhanger. The werewolf or she-wolf looks sort of weird, hairy on top but not on bottom. And she loses all her clothes with each transformation, which I don't understand. Lon Chaney never lost his clothes. Overall, it is fun to watch, and I think it is worth the purchase.
summary: Horror Tales Trying To Be Funny

reviewText: I discovered this show on my own back in the mid 1990's when it was shown on the then very new Sci-Fi channel.  I "got it" right away and managed to video tape the entire series.  A few years ago I transferred it to my DVR.  For the past fifteen years I've asked a number of sci-fi loving acquantances and friends if they'd ever heard of a series called "She Wolf of London" and the answer has always been "Huh?" or "Uh...nope", and I started to wonder if I was the only person in the world who appreciated this show and had preserved it for posterity.Well, with the advent of the Internet I discovered a smattering of souls out there who "got it" just the way I did, and had their VHS tape collections too.  So, I at least knew I wasn't totally alone, but I never really thought this show would be out on DVD.My wife and I recently got so desperate for some smart sci-fi type of show to watch together that I suggested we watch the pilot episode off my DVR, and it brought back memories of just how unique and fun this show really was.  I decided to check if at long last it might be out on a genuine legitimate commercial DVD, and low and behold here it is!  AOOOOOOWWWWW!!I especially liked the last few episodes that take place in LA.  Here, the show becomes a comedy spoof of the supernatural.  We've got our heroes trapped in a genuine old werewolf type movie, a renegade cupid who shoots arrows to get people to break up, vampires who run a law firm, molemen who don't get cable TV, etc.  It's like the people making the show knew that they were doomed so they decided to have as much fun as they could doing goofy stuff.Anyway, I hope a new generation of sci-fi/horror fans get to see this show.  Hint for enjoyment: have a sense of humor and don't expect it to be more than it was meant to be.  The characters are endearing, have chemistry, and Kate Hodge was as cutiful a leading lady as there ever was.  Enjoy.

reviewText: Way Back in 1990,3 years after Werewolf:the TV Series was cancelled. Something wonderful happend in the fall of 1990. We all got a chance to see a female Werewolf. That Werewolf was...She-Wolf of London. Starring the beautiful and talented Kate Hodge. She plays Randi Wallace,a college student that travels to London to study with mytholagy professor Dr. Ian Matheson. Played by the a great british actor Neil Dickson. And the rest of the cast is great and funny in every way. I have really no problem with the revamp of the She-Wolf of London main titles,at least they left She-Wolf end credits in tact. This series will make you cry, laugh, and sympathize completely with Randi's contition as Ian tires so desperately to help her find a cure. The episode Voodoo Child is quite evident that Ian cares about Randi. I am just loving every minute of this show. Long live Kate, Neil, Scott Fults and the rest oif the british gang as they serve up laughs. And of course the beast that Randi becomes every full moon.
summary: Yes,Yes. The She-Wolf Rules. But of Course?

reviewText: She-Wolf of London: Complete SeriesJust received the dvd series. Ordinarily, I would have given it a much higher rating. However, the original theme music was removed( why? I don't know. Maybe the moon was shining purple instead of its usual pristine color.) and replaced with the very sappy and irritating love and curses theme.I distinctly remember the theme to be very sensuous, with a mysterious undertone. That tied in beautifully with the concept of the "She-Wolf". Instead of the dvd producers maintaining that line of thought, they opted to throw in an opening theme which was so irritating that it almost made me gag. Thankfully, the contents of the episodes included little scenes that were edited by either WWOR or Sci-Fi.Also, I found a glitch in the video transfer. In the 'Little Bookshop of Horrors(?)', there is a video warp at the very beginning of the episode.[Maybe someone fell asleep at the editing table]. Come on guys! You want this sale to take off(especially in the advent of the 'Wolf-man' movie release to be coming to theaters soon), you have to pay attention!
Title: N/A

reviewText: With Buffy the Vampire Slayer series come and gone to DVD so long ago this set was long over due for release. At favorite when it aired and all 20 episodes right at your viewing. The only thing bad I can think of for this series is that its airing run was far too short.  The series deals with a collage student who travels to London after a boyfriend break up only to fall for her hunky young professor and even get a place to stay in her teacher's family's boarding house.  Both the professor and student's plans to prove the legends and myths of the world fake once and for all is turned upside down when the young lady is bitten by a were wolf and turned into one now. Suddenly they find that not only werewolves are real, but bog men, Succubi and all sorts of super natural beings ones never though really existed. The series goes from being She-Wolf In London to Love and Curses when the co stars move from London to America's California coast and go from investigating the supernatural to hosting their own paranormal talk show. With a L.A witch's pizza place and problems with the U.S. Government things are anything but normal for the she wolf and her live in lover. Especially since his very touch brings out the beast in her.
summary: She-wolf of London The Complete Series

reviewText: Well,I was half way though transfering my old scifi vhs to dvd when this came out. While I was really happy to get this,  I was also somewhat dissapointed that the begining theme was "NOT" the she wolf of london theme, but the horrible "love and curses" one which should not come untill later.  Also, the video transfer was very washed out and grainy at times. This was clearly shot on film since you can see the imperfections at times.  Some scenes are very clear, and some are grainy, or washed out or wayy to much contrast blooming durring some outdoor daytime scenes.  It would have been nice to see this little gem treated better. A comentary from the stars would have been nice too. (Neil D would make a great dr. who btw).But I guess beggars can't be choosers. At least it was a decent price.
summary: average video transfer wrong begining theme.

reviewText: I was excited to see this show had been released on DVD and I came here ready to buy it. Then I read the comments and discovered that they had replaced the atmospheric opening titles to the first 14 episodes with the idiotic Love & Curses theme.You may think I'm being silly to refuse to buy a series based solely on the opening titles being changed, but I'm sick and tired of studios screwing up DVD releases. Buying them just tells the studios that consumers don't care what they do to a show, they'll still buy it. Well, not me.I want the episodes in their original form, uncut and unaltered. This butchering of cult shows has to stop!
summary: Another DVD release I won't be buying
